items.title: Joey Keogh’s Favorite Horror Movies of 2025
bullets: • The first legitimately brilliant sharksploitation movie in almost a decade
• Keeper is vintage Oz Perkins, for better and worse
• The predominantly forest-set visuals are stunning, evoking folk horror without belaboring the point
• It’s badly paced with several major lulls where the tension dissipates completely

items.title: What Stranger Things gets right about wormholes
bullets: • Stranger Things gets right about wormholes in the fifth season of the show
• The wormhole concept emerged from Einstein's General Theory of Relativity
• Theoretical physicists still use it to explore scientific questions today
• The story is set in Indiana in a fictional town called Hawkins that gets caught up with a paranormal world

items.title: New Year’s Eve Horror Marathon Schedule
bullets: • This marathon is designed to mirror the emotional arc of New Year’s Eve itself
• It starts light and communal, escalating into chaos, and ends in quiet reflection
• The Invitation (2015) slides in seamlessly as the night quiets down
• End of Days leans fully into turn-of-the-century fear, religious horror, and looming catastrophe

items.title: How the climate crisis showed up in Americans’ lives this year: ‘The shift has been swift and stark’
bullets: • The past year was another one of record-setting heat and catastrophic storms
• But across the US, the climate crisis showed up in smaller, deeply personal ways too
• Campfires that once defined summer trips were never lit due to wildfire risks
• We asked readers to share some of the ways these changes have affected their lives

items.title: It’s easy to feel powerless about climate chaos. Here’s what gives me hope | Nina Lakhani
bullets: • It's been another year of climate chaos and inadequate political action
• But what’s given me hope are the people fighting to save our planet from catastrophe
• The uncomfortable truth is that we are not all in this together
• We didn’t all contribute to the climate crisis equally, we’re not all feeling its impacts equally

items.title: Seven environmental wins across the US in 2025 despite Trump-era reversals
bullets: • California launches methane-tracking satellite to curb methane pollution
• $100m effort is funded through the state’s cap-and-trade program
• System has helped identify and stop 10 large leaks of the colourless and odorless gas since May – the climate equivalent of taking about 18,000 cars off the road

items.title: An Idaho Bird Research Station Rises From the Ashes of a Wildfire
bullets: • Lucian Davis was the lead bander at the Lucky Peak station, a research site run by Boise State University’s Intermountain Bird Observatory (IBO) Each fall, the station hosts seasonal field technicians who study the songbirds, raptors and owls that stop at the island of habitat in a sea of open country
• But on October 4, 2024, that open country was burning

items.title: As Trump Rolls Back Protections For Wetlands, New Jersey Maintains a Higher Standard
bullets: • New Jersey is one of only two states to enact stricter regulations on wetlands
• The Trump administration moved to curtail wetland protections in November
• Environmental groups have warned the rollback could endanger millions of acres of freshwater resources and critical wildlife habitat
• The Supreme Court's 2023 decision in Sackett v
• EPA sharply limited which wetlands qualify as federally protected waters

items.title: SpaceX begins “significant reconfiguration” of Starlink satellite constellation
bullets: • About 4,400 of the company’s Starlink Internet satellites will move from an altitude of 341 miles (550 kilometers) to 298 miles (480 kilometers) over the course of 2026
• The effect will be a reduced risk of collisions between satellites whizzing through near-Earth space at nearly 5 miles per second
• The decision will “increase space safety in several ways”

items.title: 2025 was UK’s hottest and sunniest year on record, says Met Office
bullets: • 2025 was the UK’s warmest and sunniest year on record, the Met Office has confirmed
• With a mean temperature of 10.09C, 2025 now tops the list, with 2022 and 2023 the second and third warmest years
• It was only the second time since the 19th century that the mean temperature exceeded 10C
